actions.text: Amendment SA 2181 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.

Amendment SA 2181 proposed by Senator Alexander for Senator McCain to Amendment SA 2089. (consideration: CR S5094-5097; text: CR S5096) To allow States to use funding under part A of title I of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to replicate and expand successful practices from high-performing public schools.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 2181 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 2181 proposed by Senator Alexander for Senator McCain to Amendment SA 2089.

amends_amendment.purpose: In the nature of a substitute.

purpose: To allow States to use funding under part A of title I of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to replicate and expand successful practices from high-performing public schools.
